meanings.definition: Resembling a husk in appearance or texture.
meanings.sent1: The dry, husklike leaves crunched under my feet as I walked through the forest.
meanings.sent2: The corn had a husklike outer layer that protected the kernels inside.
meanings.sent3: The husklike shell of the coconut made it look like a tiny house for a squirrel.
meanings.sent4: The old barn had a husklike exterior, weathered and worn from years of standing in the sun.
meanings.sent5: The husklike skin of the peach felt rough to the touch, like sandpaper.
